name: RPA.Robocloud.Items
doc:
A library for interacting with RPA work items.

Items is a collection of keywords for handling data that is moved between different processes and Robot Framework tasks. It allows storing and restoring values to/from cloud or file based storage, and manipulating their contents.

param load_env:Automatically load work item using environment variables
param default_adapter:
 Set default adapter if not overriden by environment

Environment variables:

  • RPA_WORKITEMS_ADAPTER: Import path to adapter, e.g. "mymodule.MyAdapter"
  • RC_WORKSPACE_ID: Current default workspace ID
  • RC_WORKITEM_ID: Current default work item ID

inits.name: Init
inits.doc: Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.
inits.shortdoc: Initialize self.  See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.

keywords.name: Add Work Item File
keywords.doc:
Add given file to work item.

NOTE: Files are not uploaded before work item is saved

Example:

Add work item file    output.xls
Save work item
param path:Path to file on disk
param name:Destination name for file. If not given, current name of local file is used.
keywords.shortdoc: Add given file to work item.

keywords.name: Add Work Item Files
keywords.doc:
Add all files that match given pattern to work item.

Example:

Add work item files    %{ROBOT_ROOT}/generated/*.csv
Save work item
param pattern:Path wildcard pattern
keywords.shortdoc: Add all files that match given pattern to work item.

keywords.name: Clear Work Item
keywords.doc:
Remove all data in the current work item.

Example:

Clear work item
Save work item
keywords.shortdoc: Remove all data in the current work item.

keywords.name: Delete Work Item Variables
keywords.doc:
Delete variable(s) from the current work item.

Example:

Delete work item variables    username    email
Save work item
param names:names of variables to remove
param force:ignore variables that don't exist in work item
keywords.shortdoc: Delete variable(s) from the current work item.

keywords.name: Get Work Item File
keywords.doc:
Get attached file from work item to disk. Returns the absolute path to the created file.

Example:

${path}=    Get work item file    input.xls
Open workbook    ${path}
param name:Name of attached file
param path:Destination path of file. If not given, current working directory is used.
keywords.shortdoc: Get attached file from work item to disk. Returns the absolute path to the created file.

keywords.name: Get Work Item Files
keywords.doc:
Get files attached to work item that match given pattern. Returns a list of absolute paths to the downloaded files.

Example:

${paths}=    Get work item files    customer_*.xlsx
FOR  ${path}  IN  @{paths}
    Handle customer file    ${path}
END
param pattern:Filename wildcard pattern
param dirname:Destination directory, if not given robot root is used
keywords.shortdoc: Get files attached to work item that match given pattern. Returns a list of absolute paths to the downloaded files.

keywords.name: Get Work Item Payload
keywords.doc:
Get the full JSON payload for a work item.

NOTE: Most use cases should prefer higher-level keywords.

Example:

${payload}=    Get work item payload
Log    Entire payload as dictionary: ${payload}
keywords.shortdoc: Get the full JSON payload for a work item.

keywords.name: Get Work Item Variable
keywords.doc:
Return a single variable value from the work item, or default value if defined and key does not exist. If key does not exist and default is not defined, raises KeyError.

Example:

${username}=    Get work item variable    username    default=guest
param key:Name of variable
param default:Default value if key does not exist
keywords.shortdoc: Return a single variable value from the work item, or default value if defined and key does not exist. If key does not exist and default is not defined, raises `KeyError`.

keywords.name: Get Work Item Variables
keywords.doc:
Read all variables from the current work item and return their names and values as a dictionary.

Example:

${variables}=    Get work item variables
Log    Username: ${variables}[username], Email: ${variables}[email]
keywords.shortdoc: Read all variables from the current work item and return their names and values as a dictionary.

keywords.name: List Work Item Files
keywords.doc:
List the names of files attached to the current work item.

Example:

${names}=    List work item files
Log    Work item has files with names: ${names}
keywords.shortdoc: List the names of files attached to the current work item.

keywords.name: List Work Item Variables
keywords.doc:
List the variable names for the current work item.

Example:

${variables}=    List work item variables
Log    Available variables in work item: ${variables}
keywords.shortdoc: List the variable names for the current work item.

keywords.name: Load Work Item
keywords.doc:
Load work item for reading/writing.

NOTE: Currently only one work item per execution is supported
by Robocorp Cloud, which should be loaded automatically.
param workspace_id:
 Workspace ID which contains item
param item_id:Workitem ID to load
keywords.shortdoc: Load work item for reading/writing.

keywords.name: Load Work Item From Environment
keywords.doc:
Load current work item defined by the runtime environment.

The corresponding environment variables are:

  • RC_WORKSPACE_ID
  • RC_WORKITEM_ID
keywords.shortdoc: Load current work item defined by the runtime environment.

keywords.name: Remove Work Item File
keywords.doc:
Remove attached file from work item.

NOTE: Files are not deleted before work item is saved

Example:

Remove work item file    input.xls
Save work item
param name:Name of attached file
param missing_ok:
 Do not raise exception if file doesn't exist
keywords.shortdoc: Remove attached file from work item.

keywords.name: Remove Work Item Files
keywords.doc:
Removes files attached to work item that match given pattern.

Example:

Remove work item files    *.xlsx
Save work item
param pattern:Filename wildcard pattern
param missing_ok:
 Do not raise exception if file doesn't exist
keywords.shortdoc: Removes files attached to work item that match given pattern.

keywords.name: Save Work Item
keywords.doc: Save the current data in the work item. If not saved, all changes are discarded when the library goes out of scope.
keywords.shortdoc: Save the current data in the work item. If not saved, all changes are discarded when the library goes out of scope.

keywords.name: Set Task Variables From Work Item
keywords.doc:
Convert all variables in the current work item to Robot Framework task variables.

Example:

# Work item has variable INPUT_URL
Set task variables from work item
Log    The variable is now available: ${INPUT_URL}
keywords.shortdoc: Convert all variables in the current work item to Robot Framework task variables.

keywords.name: Set Work Item Payload
keywords.doc:
Set the full JSON payload for a work item.

NOTE: Most use cases should prefer higher-level keywords.

Example:

${output}=    Create dictionary    url=example.com    username=Mark
Set work item payload    ${output}
param payload:Content of payload, must be JSON-serializable
keywords.shortdoc: Set the full JSON payload for a work item.

keywords.name: Set Work Item Variable
keywords.doc:
Set a single variable value in the current work item.

Example:

Set work item variable    username    MarkyMark
Save work item
param key:Name of variable
param value:Value of variable
keywords.shortdoc: Set a single variable value in the current work item.

keywords.name: Set Work Item Variables
keywords.doc:
Set multiple variables in the current work item.

Example:

Set work item variables    username=MarkyMark    email=mark@example.com
Save work item
param kwargs:Pairs of variable names and values
keywords.shortdoc: Set multiple variables in the current work item.
